titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5351) to prohibit the transfer of any individual detained at United States Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R 5226) to amend chapter 3 of title 5, United States Code, to require the publication of information relating to pending agency regulatory actions, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5351) to prohibit the transfer of any individual detained at United States Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R 5226) to amend chapter 3 of title 5, United States Code, to require the publication of information relating to pending agency regulatory actions, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-744, by Mr. Byrne.
Rule provides for one hour of debate on both H.R. 5351 and H.R. 5226.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 143.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 863.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by recorded vote: 232 - 172 (Roll no. 505).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 238 - 171 (Roll no. 506).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5351) to prohibit the transfer of any individual detained at United States Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R 5226) to amend chapter 3 of title 5, United States Code, to require the publication of information relating to pending agency regulatory actions.
